title: Artists stand up to Trump and ICE at the Grammy Awards
subhed: Puerto Rican singer Bad Bunny, who made history with the first-ever Spanish-language work to win Album of the Year, targeted US immigration authorities in his acceptance speech, echoing the sentiments of many artists at the Los Angeles ceremony.
byline: By Arnaud Leparmentier (San Francisco (United States) correspondent)

title: Gaza's Rafah crossing reopened under restrictive Israeli conditions
Capgemini tries to salvage reputation by divesting controversial US subsidiary linked to ICE
'They shoot, arrest, extort. It's constant terror': In Sudan, the 'RSF State' as told by those who fled it
subhed: As the threat of Sudan being partitioned looms, the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) claims it could govern Darfur. Those who have managed to escape describe a reign of tyranny and arbitrary rule.
byline: By Noé Hochet-Bodin (Adré, Chad, special correspondent)

title: Gaza: Israeli strikes cause near-daily deaths despite ceasefire
subhed: More than 500 Palestinians have been killed since October 10, 2025, the date fighting was supposed to have stopped under the US peace plan. Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu has vowed to maintain 'security control over the entire area from the Jordan River to the sea,' including the Gaza Strip.

title: France faces a crossfire of Russian and American disinformation
subhed: Since the start of the year, pro-Russian networks and Trump-aligned accounts have increasingly targeted France. While their methods differ, they pose an unprecedented challenge.

title: 'Architect of God' Antonio Gaudí could be beatified in Spain as anniversary of death approaches
subhed: The year 2026 will mark the consecration of Barcelona's basilica, the Sagrada Família, whose tallest tower is nearing completion and is expected to be inaugurated in June in the presence of Pope Leo XIV. For some of the faithful, the astonishing building stands as a testament to the extraordinary faith of its creator, whose beatification they are calling for.

Who's running in the Paris mayoral election?
subhed: Six main candidates are vying to succeed Mayor Anne Hidalgo, who is not running for re-election, in the municipal elections on March 15 and 22.
byline: By Manon Romain and Hélène Bekmezian

title: Switzerland's ill-prepared army faces new global disorder
subhed: Despite maintaining military conscription and an extensive network of fortifications, the country remains under-equipped to address current threats such as missile or drone attacks.

title: Social media ban for under-15s: Why everyone in France will soon have to verify their age
subhed: If the bill is adopted on schedule, all social media users in France will have to undergo age verification before the end of the year.
byline: By Damien Leloup and Florian Reynaud

title: Environment: Europe's temptation to unravel hard-won progress, ignoring scientific truth
'A decline in birth rates could help France solve some of its most serious difficulties'
